Sixty North Gold to Close First Tranche of Non-Brokered $1,500,000 Unit Offering
data.description:
Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - October 30, 2025) - Sixty North Gold Mining Ltd. (FSE: 2F40) (OTC Pink: SXNTF) (the "Company" or "Sixty North Gold") is pleased to announce that the Company intends to close a first tranche of its non-brokered financing of up to 13,636,363 units (the "Units") at an offering price of $0.11 per Unit (the "Offering"), originally announced its press release dated October 22, 2025, subject to the CSE raising no objection to the closing. This first tranche is expected to close on or about November 5th, 2025.

The Company expects to close up to 5,454,545 Units in the first tranche for gross proceeds of up to $600,000. Each Unit will be comprised of one common share (each, a "Share") and one non-transferable common share purchase warrant (each, a "Warrant") in the capital of the Company. Each Warrant will be exercisable to purchase one additional Share at a price of $0.15 for a period of twenty-four (24) months from the Closing Date, subject to applicable securities laws and CSE policies.

Eligible finders will receive finder's fees of 8% in cash and 8% in warrants on the proceeds received by Sixty North Gold from investors introduced to Sixty North Gold. Leede Financial acted as a finder in the first tranche of the Offering.

The securities underlying the Units will be subject to a hold period legend restricting resale until four months and a day from their date of issuance.

The proceeds from the Offering will be used for further exploration and development of the Mon Gold Property located in NWT, and for the Company's general working capital requirements.

About the Company

Sixty North Gold is developing mining operations for gold on its 100-per-cent-owned Mon Gold Project, which extracted 15,000 tonnes of ore to depths of only 15 metres below surface, recovering an estimated 15,000 ounces of gold in the 1990s (Company Technical Report NI 43-101, August 3, 2023 on SEDAR or https://sixtynorthgold.com/projects/technical-report/. The North Ramp has been reopened and has been extended to the target portion of the vein. The company plans to develop stopes in the East Limb, West Limb and DD Zone to extract and to feed a 100 tpd gravity-flotation mill.

Additional gold, silver and base metal targets occur on the property and will be explored and developed as warranted.

The Yellowknife gold camp hosts two mines that averaged 30 gpt gold or better (Discovery Mine with one million ounces of gold produced, and Sixty North Gold's Mon Mine), and two that averaged 15 gpt or better for a total production of over 14 million ounces of gold (Con Mine and Giant Mine); (ref. Company Technical Report NI 43-101, August 3, 2023).

The technical content of this release has been reviewed and approved by Dr. D.R. Webb, P.Geol, President and CEO of Sixty North Gold Mines Ltd.

For more information, please refer to the Company's public filings available on SEDAR (www.sedarplus.ca), under the Company's profile.

ON BEHALF OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS

"Dave Webb"

Dave Webb, President & CEO

For further information, please contact:

Dave Webb

Tel.: 604 818-1400

Email: dave@drwgcl.com

Website: www.sixtynorthgold.com

Statements about the Company's future expectations and all other statements in this press release other than historical facts are "forward looking statements". Such forward-looking statements are based on numerous assumptions, and involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors, including risks inherent in mineral exploration and development, which may cause the actual results, performance, or achievements of the Company to be materially different from any projected future results, performance, or achievements expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements. Further details about the risks applicable to the Company are contained in the Company's public filings available on SEDAR (www.sedarplus.ca), under the Company's profile.

NOT FOR DISSEMINATION IN THE UNITED STATES OR FOR DISTRIBUTION TO U.S. NEWSWIRE SERVICES

THE CANADIAN SECURITIES EXCHANGE HAS NOT APPROVED NOR DISAPPROVED THE CONTENT OF THIS PRESS RELEASE.

To view the source version of this press release, please visit https://www.newsfilecorp.com/release/272684

Japan Retail Sales Growth Beats Estimates
data.description:
Retail sales in Japan unexpectedly rose 0.9% year-on-year in September 2025, rebounding from a downwardly revised 0.9% decline in the previous month and surpassing market expectations for a 0.7% increase.

On a monthly basis, retail sales climbed 0.3% in September, recovering from a downwardly revised 0.9% fall in August.

Bright Horizons Family Solutions Inc reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
data.description:
• Bright Horizons Family Solutions Inc reported quarterly adjusted earnings of $1.57​​ per share for the quarter ended September 30, higher than the same quarter last year, when the company reported EPS of $1.11. The mean expectation of nine analysts for the quarter was for earnings of $1.32 per share. Wall Street expected results to range from $1.30 to $1.35 per share.

  • Revenue rose 11.6% to $802.81 million from a year ago; analysts expected $780.68 million.

  • Bright Horizons Family Solutions Inc's reported EPS for the quarter was $1.37​.

  • The company reported quarterly net income of $78.55 million.

  • Bright Horizons Family Solutions Inc shares had fallen by 14.6% this quarter and lost 16.4% so far this year.

FORECAST CHANGES

  • The mean earnings estimate of analysts had risen by about 4% in the last three months.​

  • In the last 30 days, there have been no negative revisions of earnings estimates

RECOMMENDATIONS

  • The current average analyst rating on the shares is "buy" and the breakdown of recommendations is 5 "strong buy" or "buy," 4 "hold" and 1 "sell" or "strong sell." The average consensus recommendation for the personal services peer group is also "buy"

  • Wall Street's median 12-month price target for Bright Horizons Family Solutions Inc is $135.00, about 31.6% above its last closing price of $92.28

This summary was machine generated from LSEG data October 30 at 11:45 p.m. UTC. ​All figures in US dollars unless otherwise stated. (For questions concerning the data in this report, contact Estimates.Support@lseg.com. For any other questions or feedback, contact RefinitivNewsSupport@thomsonreuters.com)

data.title: Australia's Steadfast hits near 3-year low as CEO steps aside amid workplace complaint probe
data.description:
** Shares of Austraia's Steadfast Group fall as much as 18.9% to A$5.03, their lowest level since mid-November 2022

** The insurance broker said on Thursday CEO and Managing Director Robert Kelly has decided to stand aside temporarily while an external investigation into a workplace complaint made against him progresses

** Co added board will provide further details once this investigation is complete, and has appointed Tim Mathieson, CEO of Australasian broking to the role of acting CEO

** Stock down 2.6%, YTD

Japan Jobless Rate Steady at 2.6%, Slightly Above Consensus
data.description:
Japan’s unemployment rate held at 2.6% in September 2025, unchanged from the prior month but slightly above market expectations of 2.5%.

It remained the highest since July 2024, as the number of unemployed increased by 20,000 to a 14-month high of 1.81 million.

Meanwhile, employment rose by 240,000 to a record 68.40 million, while the labor force expanded by 250,000 to 70.14 million.

The number of people outside the labor force fell by 240,000 to 39.46 million.

On a non-seasonally adjusted basis, the labor force participation rate climbed to 64.2%, up from 63.5% a year earlier.

At the same time, the jobs-to-applicants ratio stayed at 1.20 for the second straight month, remaining the lowest level since January 2022.

Air India seeks $1.14 billion lifeline from SIA and Tata, Bloomberg News reports
data.description:
Air India is seeking at least 100 billion Indian rupees ($1.14 billion) in financial support from owners Singapore Airlines and Tata Sons, Bloomberg news reported on Thursday.

Reuters could not immediately verify the report.

($1 = 87.8950 Indian rupees)

data.title: NET Power Director and 10% Owner NPEH, LLC Sells Over 900K Shares
data.description:
Reporter NameNpeh, Llc
RelationshipDirector, 10% Owner
TypeSell
Amount$3,702,731
SEC FilingForm 4

NPEH, LLC, a 10% owner and director of NET Power, reported selling a total of 902,171 Class A Common Stock shares across three transactions on October 28, 29, and 30, 2025, with weighted average sale prices of $3.7695, $4.1166, and $4.0376 respectively. The total sale amount was $3,702,731. Following these transactions, NPEH, LLC directly owns 1,865,246 shares of NET Power.

SEC Filing: NET Power Inc. [ NPWR ] - Form 4 - Oct. 30, 2025

Australia's Mayne Pharma eyes worst day ever as Treasurer weighs blocking its buyout
data.description:
** Shares of Mayne Pharma Group fall as much as 38.6% to A$3.81, hitting their lowest level since August 21, 2024

** Stock set for weakest trading session ever, if current trends hold

** Co received letter from potential acquirer Cosette Pharma, saying country's treasurer was looking to block A$672 million ($436.67 million) buyout of the firm

** Stock down 12.5% YTD, including the day's moves

($1 = 1.5389 Australian dollars)

data.title: Australian treasurer weighs blocking Mayne Pharma's $437 million takeover
data.description:
Australia's Mayne Pharma said on Friday it had received a letter from its potential acquirer, Cosette, stating that the country's treasurer was seeking to block the A$672 million ($436.67 million) buyout of the company.

Cosette has been trying to terminate its offer, after saying in May that it was reviewing the deal because of a "material adverse change" in Mayne's performance.

In late May, the stock had fallen to A$4.31 in its weakest trading session since March 2009, when Mayne disclosed Cosette's review of the offer.

Shares in Mayne Pharma fell as much as 38.6% to A$3.81 in their weakest intraday performance ever. The stock hit its lowest level since August 21, 2014.

The letter stated the treasurer indicated that his "preliminary view is that the proposed acquisition would be contrary to the national interest" because it would negatively impact the Australian economy and community.

Cosette or the office of the treasurer did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

($1 = 1.5389 Australian dollars)

data.title: Nikkei May Rise on Weaker Yen — Market Talk
data.description: Japanese stocks may rise as the yen weakens sharply following the Bank of Japan's decision to keep its policy rate unchanged on Thursday. Nikkei futures are up 0.2% at 51535 on the SGX. USD/JPY is at 154.00, up sharply from 153.04 as of Thursday's Tokyo stock market close. Investors are focusing on any progress in Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's policy steps to bolster the economy. The Nikkei Stock Average closed flat at 51325.61 on Thursday. (kosaku.narioka@wsj.com)
